dynamic-element.name: question
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: What is the purpose of EVP?

dynamic-element.name: answer
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: The purpose of EVP is to promote and instill a spirit of charity and service throughout Liferay. We recognize that many Liferay employees joined our company largely because they believe in our "For Life" vision. Our employeesâ€™ corporate skills are great assets to Liferay, Inc., and in addition to that, many people have passions for effecting social impact both in their local communities and worldwide. Therefore, we hope EVP provides unique opportunities for employees to practically live out their passion for charity and service.

dynamic-element.name: category_header
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: Eligibility

dynamic-element.name: question
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: When am I eligible for EVP?

dynamic-element.name: answer
dynamic-element.dynamic-content:
In order to participate in EVP, you must have been employed by Liferay for the following amount of time:

Full time employees: eligible ${subsidiary.configuration.minimum.required.months.since.full.time.hire.date} months after their hire date.

<c:choose>
<c:when test="${subsidiary.configuration.employment.temporary.enabled}">

Temporary employees: eligible ${subsidiary.configuration.minimum.required.months.since.temporary.hire.date} months after their hire date, even if their employment status changes to full-time during those ${subsidiary.configuration.minimum.required.months.since.temporary.hire.date} months.

</c:when>
<c:otherwise>

Temporary employees are not eligible to participate in EVP.

</c:otherwise>
</c:choose> <c:choose>
<c:when test="${subsidiary.configuration.employment.part.time.enabled}">

Part time employees: eligible ${subsidiary.configuration.minimum.required.months.since.part.time.hire.date} months after their hire date and only if they work ${subsidiary.configuration.minimum.part.time.working.hours.per.week} hours a week.

</c:when>
<c:otherwise>

Part time employees are not eligible to participate in EVP.

</c:otherwise>
</c:choose>

dynamic-element.name: category_header
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: Request Qualifications

dynamic-element.name: question
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: What causes qualify for my service and grant requests?

dynamic-element.name: answer
dynamic-element.dynamic-content:
1. Disaster Relief (e.g., providing supplies, rebuilding, trauma counseling).
  2. Providing Food, Water, and Shelter (e.g., building wells, soup kitchens).
  3. Basic Health and Education (e.g., hygiene, disease prevention, literacy, math).
  4. Vocational Empowerment (e.g., trade, craft, or other skills to earn a living).
  5. Freedom and Justice (e.g., working against human trafficking, modern slavery, unjust imprisonment).

dynamic-element.name: category_header
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: Service Requests

dynamic-element.name: question
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: What are some examples of eligible service requests?

dynamic-element.name: answer
dynamic-element.dynamic-content:
• Rebuilding homes for earthquake victims (disaster relief).
  • Preparing meals for the homeless (food).
  • Building a health clinic's IT infrastructure in a third-world country (basic health).
  • Teaching computer skills to the urban poor for career development (vocational empowerment).
  • Publishing marketing literature for organizations combating sex-trafficking (freedom and justice).

dynamic-element.name: question

dynamic-element.name: answer
dynamic-element.dynamic-content:

  • Grants to support an organization that provides meals for the homeless (food).

dynamic-element.name: question
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: What kind of expenses are eligible for reimbursement using a Sponsorship grant?

dynamic-element.name: answer
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: Only expenses related to lodging, food, supplies, or travel are eligible for reimbursement. Reimbursement for these expense categories are only allowed if the sole purpose for these expenses is to aid in your service.

dynamic-element.name: category_header
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: Tax Deductions

dynamic-element.name: question
dynamic-element.dynamic-content: Can I get a tax deduction for the travel expenses I pay for an EVP trip?

dynamic-element.name: answer
dynamic-element.dynamic-content:
Eligible lodging, supply, or travel expenses related to service that are not reimbursed are deductible on your tax returns. For example, if you spent $2000 on eligible expenses and were reimbursed for $500 of those expenses, you can still claim $1500 in deductions when you file your taxes. Make sure to keep the following records for audit purposes:

  • Proof from the organization that you served on the dates you requested.
  • Receipts that clearly display your service-related expenses.

Please consult your tax advisor for full details on how to make these deductions.
